section.title: Description
section.p: This data type represents an Interval, where the Low and High Limits are Physical Quantities. An Interval is a "set of consecutive values of an ordered base data type." - HL7 V3 A Physical Quantity is "a dimensioned quantity expressing the result of measuring" - HL7 V3
The amount of the therapeutic agent or other substance given at one administration event.

stentry.p: "The high limit of the interval. The high limit SHALL NOT be negative infinity, and SHALL be higher than the low limit if one exists." - HL7 V3. This property contains the Unit of Measure of the high limit. The unit of measure specified in the Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) [].

The magnitude of the quantity measured in terms of the unit. "The high limit of the interval. The high limit SHALL NOT be negative infinity, and SHALL be higher than the low limit if one exists." - HL7 V3. This property contains the numeric portion (i.e., not including any units of measure) of the high limit.

"The low limit of the interval. The low limit SHALL NOT be positive infinity." - HL7 V3. This property containsthe Unit of Measure of the low limit. The unit of measure specified in the Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) [].

"The low limit of the interval. The low limit SHALL NOT be positive infinity." - HL7 V3 This property contains the numeric portion (i.e., not including any units of measure) of the low limit. The magnitude of the quantity measured in terms of the unit.
